m2mimud.state
Class GameState

java.lang.Object
  m2mimud.state.GameState
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Externalizable, java.io.Serializable
public class GameState
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Externalizable

The GameState is the class which contains all the state information about the session that the user is in. This contains data about the location of the ponds, merchants, houses, monsters, as well as the players in the game. Both the World and the GameSystem use and update this as state changes happens, so that there is no need to determine the state every time the broadcast happens.

See Also:

public java.lang.Object get(int which,

which - The integer code for what the user want

public java.util.Iterator getCollection(int which)

synchronize

public void synchronize(GameState other,
                        World theWorld)
Each portion sent out by the various units within a session can be though of as fragments of a much larger global state. This function takes in a fragment from a given unit and it uses it to perform some synchronization if need be.

Parameters:
other - A fragment of the global state to use to perform synchonization
theWorld - the world object to modify
